Edmore Moyo

  • etmoyo@gmail.com
  • www.edmoremoyo.com
  • github.com/edmore
  • @etmoyo

Goal

My career goal is to "invent", platforms and services, so that future computer scientists and engineers can build on my work. I aim to be involved and to nurture open source communities in order to promote continuous sharing and learning.

Summary

I am curious. I enjoy learning about technology and investigating how it can improve peoples lives. I love research, I believe in understanding computer science fundamentals and building on those fundamentals. I am currently a part-time Masters in Computer Science student at the University of Cape Town (UCT).

I work full-time at the Centre for Innovation in Learning and Teaching (CILT) at the UCT. I also form part of the leadership on an open source Lecture Recording platform, Opencast Matterhorn, used by various universities across the world.

experience

  1. 2012-Present

    Committer • Opencast Matterhorn Project

    • Contribute to the Matterhorn Project, primarily as a front-end developer, ensuring easy accessibility to media content.
    • Have contributed over 20 patches and have filed numerous bug issues.

  2. 2011-Present

    Online Learning Environments Developer • CILT, UCT

    • Responsible for research, deployment, maintenance and support of large scale Learning Management Systems (LMS) at the UCT.
    • One of the lead developers on the UCT Lecture Recording project, and was involved in the deployment of the Matterhorn Lecture Recording system, that went into production in 2013. There have been over 2000 recordings to date, 25 venues equipped and over 100 courses setup.
    • Responsible for upgrades and continuous code changes.
    • UI related development for the LMS, Vula (based on the open source platform Sakai), on a per need basis.
    • Facilitated the integration of Vula and Matterhorn to ensure that students are able to easily view recordings.
    • Manage the Matterhorn server cluster (admin and engage node, worker nodes, streaming server and database server). This includes storage requirements, logging, VM resourcing (involves liasing with the ICTS department), system monitoring etc.
    • Installation, configuration management and maintainence of lecture capture devices.

  3. 2010-2011

    Back-end Developer / QA Engineer • Unboxed Consulting (PTY) Ltd

    • Quality Assurance Engineer on the team that launched the new bespoke Channel5 UK website. We were a distributed team, split between Cape Town, South Africa and London, UK.
    • Ruby back-end developer for the Big Brother UK project, for Channel 5.
    • Ruby back-end developer involved in the code refactoring exercise for the Timesheets application, used by Unboxed. We added extra functionality and enhanced the user experience.

  4. 2007-2010

    Analyst Developer • Mimosa Mining Company.

    • Ensured 24-hour availabity of the platinum mine's Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system.
    • Designed and developed the Intranet application that was used mine-wide to serve over 2000 employees. The application served up to date documents, up to date production statistics and had many more other features.
    • Developed a Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) system that was used to track PPE usage in high PPE usage departments at the mine.
    • Part of the team that investigated and launched the new HR system, "Absalom HR". I also ensured its maintenance, upgrades and support were effectively carried out.
    • An active member of the team that ensured our department, Management Information Systems (MIS), had all the necessary documentation to meet the health and safety requirements.
    • Appointed a mine-wide ISO 14001 and OHSAS 18001 internal auditor in 2010, in preparation for the external audit, we were successfully recertified that year.
    • During my tenure at the mine, I filled various capacities, some short term : Analyst Developer, Internal Health and Safety Auditor, Acting Business Systems Manager (Head Of Section) and Acting MIS Manager (Head Of Department).

  5. 2006-2007

    Graduate Trainee • National Social Security Authority (NSSA)

    • Designed and redeveloped the parastatal's website.

  6. 2006-2006

    Developer • CyberplexAfrica

    • Developed a banner management system that was used by the two most popular, most visited, newspaper sites in the country, The Herald and The Chronicle, to serve advertisements on their websites.

Industry recognition

Writing

I maintain a technical blog ( www.edmoremoyo.com/blog ) detailing my experiences in the industry.

Projects

My open source projects are freely available on my github ( github.com/edmore ).

Technical skills

I am a predominantly a generalist software developer but also an intermediate *nix systems administrator, with an affinity for learning new programming languages. I have however managed to gain proficiency in certain languages and paradigms over the years.

  • Ruby (proficient) and related frameworks such as Sinatra and Rails.
  • JavaScript (proficient) and libraries like jQuery.
  • Go(lang) - I am currently using it to implement a use case for my MSc. thesis project.
  • Bash
  • Perl
  • Scheme
  • C
  • Erlang

My editor of choice is Emacs and I use LaTeX for my academic work. I also have experience with other technologies, practices and platforms such as :

  • *nix, Mac OSX,
  • SQL, Redis, MySQL,
  • Apache, Nginx, Thin,
  • SoX, FFmpeg, openRTSP, Gstreamer,
  • Ansible,
  • Java, PHP,
  • Regular expressions,
  • Maven, Rake, Make,
  • Git, SVN,
  • Jenkins, Travis CI,
  • Scrum, TDD and many more.
